intro: Echinops sevanensis, commonly known as the Sevan thistle, is a species of flowering plant native to the highlands of Armenia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, producing yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Echinops sevanensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential ecological and medicinal properties.
